fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • We said of Sizewell B that millions of gallons of filtered North Sea water per second are pumped in to cool this nuclear station's essential equipment. A reader thought this would require a pretty big pipe. The volume is actually 44 million gallons an hour, or 12,000 gallons per second (A working life: Fission trip, 25 June, page 3, Work). • A column said that the FDA – the union for senior civil servants formerly called the First Division Association – had raised the prospect of joining this week's public-sector strikes if talks over pensions broke down. Rather, the FDA had said it would be likely to ballot members over industrial action in the autumn, if pension talks break down (The wrong target, 22 June, page 9, Society). • A piece about the presenter of, among other things, television's University Challenge, gave the name of Jeremy Paxman's Cambridge college as St Catherine's when it should have been St Catharine's (Who failed University Challenge? 28 June, page 5).
